TunableVariant.name: tests_or_greeting
TunableVariant.description: Either play a greeting if the tests pass, or reference another TunableTestedGreetingTargeted that will perform it's behavior if the tests pass.

TunableTuple.name: si
TunableTuple.description: Super reactions that allow the Sim to play an SI before socializing. These can be Social Super Interactions which work well so that we guarantee the Sim is within social constraints. Since these can be touching socials, you can have a social super interaction that uses a jig group.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push on the subject.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_run_priority
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the priority at which the affordance runs. This may be different than 'affordance_priority'. For example. you might want an affordance to push at high priority such that it cancels existing interactions, but it runs at a lower priority such that it can be more easily canceled.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The run priority for the specified affordance.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the pushed interaction will target a specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be targeted by the pushed interaction.

TunableVariant.name: override_interaction_source
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will override the source of this pushed SI. For example if we don't want a pushed SI to be easily canceled by another user directed interaction, we can set this to be SCRIPT_WITH_USER_INTENT.

TunableTuple.name: tests
TunableTuple.description: Child TunableTestedGreetingTargeted nodes that run if the tests pass.

TunableList.name: child_nodes
TunableList.description: A list of children to run through as children of this branch. If any one passes, it will not process any more children.

Tunable.description: A child node that represents a set of tests to run as well as child nodes or a greeting.
